website_summaries.verdict: You won't find a stronger, more durable fishing line in this price range.
pros: Tough line that holds up well over time
Excellent quality and durability for the price
cons: Some have complained that the line has so much memory that it easily gets twisted and tangled

customer_reviews.title: Great fishing line for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this fishing line for many years for everything freshwater. The strength is great, the stretch is great, and the solar collector is easy to see. My only problem with this is line is memory retention that makes it difficult with spinning gear.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold 5 lbs much less 50 Ibs...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the "50 Pound Test-275 Yard" option as this brand and weight was recommended on another website to use to hang bird feeders to prevent squirrels from being able to climb onto the feeders. My bird feeder, when it is full, weighs about 3.5 Ibs. Withing 24 hours, the line snapped and the bird feeder was on the ground. Not sure who tested this line and determined it can withstand 50 lbs but they were dead wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Really Bad Experience
customer_reviews.text: Intended to buy the 20-lb spool, but ended up with the 50'. Okay, so I tried to use it as backer for some of my heavier outfits. My experience with this stuff was horrible. The line acted like it had been on a shelf for years....it was twisted, kinky and virtually unmanageable. Never again. My other experience with Big Game line has been good...I use the 30' leader frequently, with to problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bob O.

customer_reviews.title: The best line I've ever used..
customer_reviews.text: Berkeley Big Game Clear is the only line I use for salmon fishing in my beloved Alaska. Regardless of strength rating, this line exhibits all features desired by serious fishers: accurate strength rating, low memory and resistance to abrasion. I've used this line in both fresh and saltwater, the latter needing only rinsing in freshwater after use. Also, I use Berkeley Big Game on my bait casters and spinners. This among the best fishing products I've ever bought. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: AVgrayb12

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a go to for my trolling rods. 60 lb. test is the way to go when fishing for large striped bass in the Chesapeake. I am sure there is more expensive and better quality but this stuff is tough, holds up well in harsh conditions and takes a good knot.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Eric G

customer_reviews.title: Good line.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert on fishing line but I haven't had any trouble with this so far. I was able to spool my own reel fairly easily and I haven't had any trouble with this line twisting up on me while I fish which is something I've definitely dealt with when using cheaper fishing line. I wish I could tell you that I landed a 60 pound beauty on this line but, alas, I can't. Biggest thing I've caught with this is a few pound bass.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor R.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Mono for Cheap Fishing
customer_reviews.text: I used this for fishing with spinning reels Pros: Cheap Good for bottom fishing Good for cheap fishing Cons: Lots of memory Not great for casting Tips: Soak the line in warm/lukewarm water and spool it on your reel. This reduces memory and allows the line to seat in your reel better.
customer_reviews.author: wes

customer_reviews.title: Too much memory
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get the line to straighten out. Probably sat on the shelf for 10 years. Birds nest every cast.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Unconventional Use
customer_reviews.text: Besides fishing, the 60lb line is great for cleaning out hearing aid vents. Yep, it has the right thickness for that. My grandmother had a hearing aid vent cleaning tool that resembled weak fishing line with a small handle attached, and the tool would fall apart quickly. Now I use small pieces of this 60lb line on her hearing aid vents, and it lasts through numerous vent cleanings, before getting too bent to continue using. I bought a large spool, so we have plenty.
customer_reviews.author: TurboShopper

customer_reviews.title: love Berkley, but the spool was broken
customer_reviews.text: I like 'berkley line, but a little concerned....they spool came with a big chunk broken out of it? the line is protruding up above it now. Hope it doesn't affect the line integrity? the chunk isn''t inside the shrink wrap so I know it was packaged after it had already been broken.
customer_reviews.author: Magic

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic line
customer_reviews.text: For throwing very light lures <3/8ounce this is not a very good line. Has more than average memory. Heavy lures >3/4 ounce, this line does fine. Works well on spinning, baitcaster, or spin cast reels. Very good for trolling and live or cut bait use. In 22 years of using this line, I've never felt this line breaks under rated strength. In fact I've straightened out 3/0 circle hooks using 20lb test. All anecdotal I know, but i hope they never stop making this line.
customer_reviews.author: akt

customer_reviews.title: not good and its the trash now
customer_reviews.text: this line is not good...strong but dont stay on the fishing wheels...jumps out and become a messs all the time
customer_reviews.author: maxwell

customer_reviews.title: The standard
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand for years. I am sure there are nicer lines out there, but I am happy with the consistency and quality of this line. The price is right. Sometimes I have not changed my line from the previous year and it still holds up pretty well. I am also fishing light tackle with spinning reels. I use #10 for all size stripers and blues. My drag is set at #2 --#3. This means lots of drag pulled and the resulting line twist. I may not be able to drag the twist out at the end of the day. This does not seem to cause long term problems. Just get the twist out next time.
customer_reviews.author: WillDo

customer_reviews.title: Slinky
customer_reviews.text: Came off the spool like a slinky. I left some line on for backing but that's about all it's good for. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stretch

customer_reviews.title: Good quality Mono fishing line, used for top shot on braid for its abrasion resistance
customer_reviews.text: Great versatile monofilament line, I use this as a top shot on a conventional setup about 10 foot on attached to braid for bottom fishing, this is abrasion resistant great for when fishing structures and rocky bottom or wrecks. I also use this same line to fill the spool for kids and novice anglers targeting larger fish, it has a little stretch with recoil to the line so it’s somewhat forgiving and easier on hands.
customer_reviews.author: Jamaal80 Brooklyn Fishing Club

customer_reviews.title: New product
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid when I ordered this the line would be older and had sat around. The exact opposite. Based on the code on the reel the line came from the factory only a month prior. This stuff is tough and flexible. Great for loading trolling reels. My last stuff lasted almost 3 years. Not heavy fishing but hey it’s well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: tstuart

customer_reviews.title: The line was O.K.
customer_reviews.text: This line was O.K. It works really well for Texas rigs and wacky rigs but I would NOT use this for crank baits. It snapped mine off on a Largemouth that was probably not even 3 pounds. If you really want to use this for crank baits I would recommend a 15-17 pound test, but if you are like me and you don’t want to risk losing your lures I would get braid. After this I got spiderwire 15 pound test and I’ve never snapped off on a fish.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Halik

customer_reviews.title: Solid line
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using the 8lb for years catching large mouth, crappie and pike in New England lakes and ponds. Great stuff, never had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: If you're here for shooting line for a spey rod keep looking
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, I usually use berkeley pro spec for shooting line on my skagit rig but ran out and purchase this to replace it huge mistake they're not even close to the same quality this line has lots of memory gets deformed easily and stretches and tangles into knots readily. Might make decent gear fishing line but as far as shooting line for a spey rod pass I'll stick with the pro spec even if it is more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Chase W.

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap mono
customer_reviews.text: Super cheap and works great. Got spools of this ranging from 10-50lb. I generally use braid but this makes for great leader and backing, and I’m sure it makes for great mainline as well. I love how inexpensive it is so I line all my new reels with this stuff and take em to the park for some test casts to make sure I want to keep the reel before I put on the expensive braid.
customer_reviews.author: Yammo

customer_reviews.title: right at home in galveston
customer_reviews.text: we have been using big game line for years and it has never let us down. we had never tried the coastal brown color so we decided to try it for a first ever fishing trip to galveston. it worked great on all of our reels and we did very well catching speckled trout and drum. great product.
customer_reviews.author: longdrive67

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't break the bank.
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for value, you can't go wrong with Berkley Big Game. Perfect for any angler on a budget. Also an excellent choice for people who are learning to use a baitcaster. If you need to cut out a few birds nests, you're not going to break the bank going this route. It does have some stretch, as all monofilament does. No issues with breaking. Durable stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jed

customer_reviews.title: Got The Job Done at Flamingo!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two new fishing rods and needed to add some monofilament to them, this spool was just what I needed. Sturdy and durable I put it right to the test days later on a 2 day fishing trip to Flamingo, southwest corner of the Everglades. The 10 pound test got the job done as it landed a dozen snook, hand full of reds and blacks and ended with a 10lb Goliath Grouper.
customer_reviews.author: Javier & Annaliet

customer_reviews.title: The hell with Flouro leader material ...this is all you need...trust me!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Trilene for 34 years before braid...now all I use is PP braid and Trilene big game as my leader...I wont fish without this combination...caught a 145lb black tip with 80lb mono Trilene.
customer_reviews.author: PrynceAl

customer_reviews.title: Careful on the product selection list, odd numbers are Kg not pounds.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value for line but the product listing was incorrect. Listing said 9lb line apparently it meant 9kg (which is 20lb). Unable to tell such from the product photo. So i received a 20lb line which is not what I needed. Amazon wanted to block my review with photo proof. No customer service was offered to rectify. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: cheap twists easily
customer_reviews.text: This stuff just isn't very durable. It is strong, but twists and knots up very easily. Went tuna fishing and after one 20lb fish, this was a rats nest on my reel. Get what you pay for I guess. Next time, I'm going to invest in better line.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley C.

customer_reviews.title: so much memory it puts your xbox to shame
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how old this line is but it has more memory than a brand spanking new Dell Computer. A good fisherman stores the line they have out of light and heat to preserve it's strength and integrity. This line is going to do nothing but knot up with each cast. I will NEVER buy line from here again...NEVER!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Miller

customer_reviews.title: Its Tough Stuff
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 50lbs test to make some permanent texas rigs so my Fiancee can use snap swivels. Let me just say it was a mistake. Not because the product was bad, it was because it was so durable I could barely tie the knots I needed too. It took me about an hour to ties 6 knots because I couldn't get the line to cooperate. This is not a bad thing, as I know it will never break on the bass she will be catching.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Old school
customer_reviews.text: I have use this line since I was a teenager and had very good experience with this brand of line quality and cheap
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: meh, not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd give it a shot since braid is so pricey. Going back to power pro. for me its worth the extra strength, castability, sensitivity. i suppose it would be fine for drop fishing for smaller fish off a boat. but i'm casting heavy weights from shore most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: O. Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Excessive line memory
customer_reviews.text: Relatively heavy gauge line on a small diameter spool simply results in excessive line memory. As soon as I freed the end of the line off the spool it all started to jump off. Consequently it was a pain to spool up my reel, and then it adversely affected distance trying to cast with a spinning surf rod & reel. I was trying to use it on a Daiwa 5000 Black Gold reel. Probably just fine for an off-shore trolling reel I imagine.
customer_reviews.author: RubberDouggie

customer_reviews.title: Good line!
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this for my wind chimes. I have over 30 and the threads were disintegrating over the years. This line will be better than the line that came on them and should last for several years. Of course, if you want to go fishing, I would recommend this, too.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Been sitting around in a hot place a long time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and put it on 4 reels. Big mistake and a waste of my time. Maybe this was such a good deal because it is garbage. This line tangled right off the bat and appeared as if it was on my reel for years. I am not bashing the brand just this item in particular. Wish I could send it back.
customer_reviews.author: no reason for name

customer_reviews.title: This like works great on spinning tackle!!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I bought a 6000 yard spool of 10lb test beg game. Other reviews said it was no good for spinning tackle, but that’s not true. This line is bad to the bone. It’s strong, and works flawlessly on spinning tackle. I can cast forever with my Gloomis sjr844 with my Van Staal VS 100. I’m actually in love with this line. I’ve been nailing the bass, and zero break offs.
customer_reviews.author: Flat earther

customer_reviews.title: Try Big Game for your next refill!
customer_reviews.text: Really strong line that seems to hold up well. People who fish have their favorites, and Berkeley Big Game came highly recommended from a couple of my fishermen friends. Has good knot strength as well. I'm sold on it!
customer_reviews.author: Paniolo Pete

customer_reviews.title: Strong line
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Berkley Big game for years. It’s hard to beat. I use 12lb since it covers a variety of fish I catch. I’ve caught plenty of large mouth, small mouth, catfish, and even stripers up to 30lbs! This line is tough and worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Bovard

customer_reviews.title: Good line
customer_reviews.text: Bought this line for backing on my fly reel that I use for musky, 4 years ago bought same line has not let me down, have caught many fish with it. This year I redone line with same as had before so will be ready for the next bite.
customer_reviews.author: muskyhunter36

customer_reviews.title: still not good.
customer_reviews.text: the one i received was very old, line never stretched back out and would come off the reel in circles/loops which led to issues. even after hours of use, still not good.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle C

customer_reviews.title: Terrible experience with fishing line!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Twist to easy around pole after using whopper Popper's or any other spinning bait!!! Gets so bad with twists,gets around tip of pole,if you don't see it will break your lure off when you cast!!!!!! Lost quite a few lures that way!! Very very very pissed about that happening!!! Good luck if you buy this line and want to use spinning lures!!! Berkeley should say something about that problem!!!! Frustrated with this line!
customer_reviews.author: Kraig Kryger

customer_reviews.title: Fish on!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, this is some good fishing line for heavy weight line. I dont have to worry about it breaking on me. Already got a fish on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Roll Seems Small
customer_reviews.text: My son uses 50 pound fishing string to make toys out of beads. He ran out and I haven't felt good so didn't want to run to the store. I ordered online instead. The line works well and is 50 pound strenth but the roll seems to be really small to be 275 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Ceballos

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Trilene Big Game line for many years. The quarter pound spools are a great value. I've used it on baitcasting, spinning and larger levelwind reels and have always been satisfied with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: MSM

customer_reviews.title: Birds Nest Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: This line is cheap and strong but it has an elephant's memory. Trying to get is spooled is an exercise in frustration. I would almost sear that somehow they managed to twist the line as they wrapped it on the spool.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Shave

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Love this! it’s very sturdy and I know bc I caught several things of great size and weight, including a horseshoe crab. Definitely a steal if you’re looking for inexpensive line that’s strong and lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Used to hang globe from ceiling
customer_reviews.text: Use this to hang an vintage globe from my ceiling with a hook. It holds up well. Gave the rest to my dad for fishing - not sure how it did there. But, definitely a good invisible string for hanging larger objects.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Quality Line, Dependable
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with Berkley Trilene mono line performance (25 lb. test) because it offers smooth casting with no tangles/bird's nest in the spool. And, knots can be tied effectively with ease. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BT0414

customer_reviews.title: 25 lb test breaks at 14.2 lbs
customer_reviews.text: I tested this line by tying one end to a post and the other to my bow scale which is pretty accurate. The line is breaking in the middle, well away from the knots at an average of 14.2 lbs. Maybe this is a bad batch but I don't trust it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dan A.

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I use this when fishing for large catfish. A great performer! Had many battles with fish weighing well over test rating and fighting heavily the entire time and never lost one. Great line!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great for invisible deer fence
customer_reviews.text: I strung this between a few poles for an invisible deer fence - worked great until the jerks broke it! Probably should've strung it a little more carefully. 10/10 gold ducks.
customer_reviews.author: John Tabor

customer_reviews.title: Strong line at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I really like this line. I use the 15 lb line bank fishing the Missouri River in Montana for 20+ inch trout with a 12 lb leader in case the hook gets snagged, so I only lose the hook or leader in that case. I have landed sturgeon and huge 30 plus lb unwanted carp with this 15 lb line. It does the job for sure. I highly recommend it. Also, if you like night fishing, the solar line lights up incredibly bright with a up light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's Trilene Big Game, What Else Is There to Say?
customer_reviews.text: If you've fished much, you probably know Trilene. You might not use monofilament line but you likely have used the brand. It's about all I use for freshwater and some saltwater.
customer_reviews.author: DMAC

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great fishing line! I bought it for my garden to prevent the deers put. Easy to use and great price! Fast delivery as well. Arrived right on time to save my tomatoes!
customer_reviews.author: A. X.

customer_reviews.title: usually I don't mind so much but this stuff is terrible, taking it off my reel and putting it ...
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap but every 10 casts or so it gets tangled up, usually I don't mind so much but this stuff is terrible, taking it off my reel and putting it in the trash
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: Crafty
customer_reviews.text: Durable. Used to “float” witches hats from the ceiling of our front porch on Halloween. We had high winds and they held up. Plenty left over for future crafts!
customer_reviews.author: Happy to Help

customer_reviews.title: Best mono line I know of.  A must-have
customer_reviews.text: I have used this line for decades and always loved it. 12-15lb big game is my preference for any kind of fish between 3 and 30lbs. I use this on baitcasters and spin casting reels.
customer_reviews.author: RandomNerdGuy

customer_reviews.title: Do not use this on along gear, great on casting reels.
customer_reviews.text: Great value, but don't use this on spinning gear only for casting gear or leaders it has a lot of memory and will knot on spinning tackle. Stronger the test strength no compliants holds knots well.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Good line!
customer_reviews.text: It has a bit of memory at first but eventually straightens out after some minor use. I use this for shock leader line on my light surf rods and it splices well with the main braided line. No issues so far!
customer_reviews.author: BobClem

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Used trolling for striped bass in California San Luis reservoir. Need the mono for shock absorption as hits can be violent. 30lb test for the big ones. We troll big heavy setups. Tie it up with uni knots. Works perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Nice and limp
customer_reviews.text: Have not bought Berkley line in quite some time. I usually use Ande Pink I am really impressed with this Berkley line. I bought the 25 pound test. Line runs nice and is limp coming off spool. Line also tested at rated (slightly above) test on my line testing rig. Great price also. Will consider using this line in heavier tests now.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Olson

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The only way it could improve is if they shipped braided line by mistake. They didn't but it was a gift and the person that got it is very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony775

customer_reviews.title: strong line for big fish
customer_reviews.text: I bought this line for one rod where I wanted stronger line for big fish. I haven't put it to the test on any whoppers yet. Easy enough to spool on the reel and no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: hikerellis

customer_reviews.title: Great value but memory is hard to manage
customer_reviews.text: I might not set it up properly. But the tweak is just so so terrible. I could not cast with twist right in the middle of the rings. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Not a main line, but has it's pros
customer_reviews.text: My only real gripe is that no matter how I try to spool this stuff it has MAJOR line twist. It's just a pain to use for a main line. Now as a low cost, long lasting supply of "rig" trying or leader material this stuff is great.
customer_reviews.author: BullNY

customer_reviews.title: Durable as always!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite monofilament ever! Reliable stretchable durable and with the right amount of poundage the rocks won't interfere with your catch!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie r Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Good Line/Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I am able to re-line all of my rigs and still have some left over. The line is good monofilament line which holds up well for multiple years. I also prefer the rented line as it works better in the waters that I typically fish. Fish on my friend!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. It's inexpensive and works great. It is one of the best deals you can get on monofilament line. Never have found anything wrong with the line (nicks, etc). have switched all of my poles to this stuff exclusively, Using the 8 lb on my general fishing poles and the 12 lb in the darker green for my steelhead trolling pole. Would, and have, suggested this line to anyone who asks my opinion on what line to get.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Best Value/Quality Line
customer_reviews.text: Best value in mono line. Has a lot of stretch, but that's good for big fish. Super durable just lower sensitivity so I just use it as top shot or trolling line.
customer_reviews.author: Reel-Lentless

customer_reviews.title: Good Budget Line
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for smaller fish. It is also perfect for household tasks. We are using it to separate a battery from the top case of a MacBook Pro, and it works a treat.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Strong and perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this spool of line for fishing of big catfishes, and it handles it well! The string is very strong with a good memory that I need. Caught several nice fishes with it already! Good product!
customer_reviews.author: Chen Wei

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make jewelry and it has a good ten salon strength so that the cord going through the bead does not break would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Slippers Racing Stables

customer_reviews.title: really liked the fishing line plan to use it next fishing trip
customer_reviews.text: i loved this fishing line i hope to use it next fishing trip i also plan to take it into a fishing store and see if they can put it onto my fishing pole for me. no fish stands a chance against me and my berkley trilene big game monofilament custom spool 60 pound clear fish line. i would love to see the looks on the fish's face's when they get caught with this wonderful fish line every one that loves fishing really really really needs to buy at leat 20 - 30 spools of this line. yes its that damn good!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: nathan

customer_reviews.title: For the money it should be five stars!
customer_reviews.text: My bias is toward mono in general. For the money this is a great buy. But I can fish with mono. I hope I wasn't misleading but theseare my personal feelings.
customer_reviews.author: Toderick Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Good For What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I bough this fishing line to use for a Sante Rig. The fishing line worked as it should with no problems. I know people complained about the line holding a circle shape. It did, but it wasn't that bad or difficult to work around.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua L.

customer_reviews.title: Consistently reliable fishing line.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Berkley Trilene big game fishing line for over 15 years. It has always performed exceptionally well. I like its enduring strength and flexibility. I use mainly 40lbs test line in exclusively salt water for Striped Bass and Blue fish and have never felt that I should have been using some other line. The only negative about this line is that it retains more memory then I would like. But that being said allot of other lines that I've tried in the past had similar problems without offering the other positive characteristics of this line. So until something better comes along, I will continue to use Berkley Trilene Big Game line.
customer_reviews.author: Wdm2

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I used this to hang banners and signs in a store. This line is strong, easy to work with, and unobtrusive to the eye. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: ElectronVolt

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market
customer_reviews.text: Trilene one of the best fishing lines out there today have been using trilene line for a about 15 years and still love it.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Not the best line in town by far, but also a decent value for the money, so you have to weigh the two and figure out which brand works for you, this one is OK!
customer_reviews.author: B. Hinson

customer_reviews.title: one stop shopping
customer_reviews.text: jump up and down about fishing stuff...nope..just happy to get everything I need in one place...what is jump up and down for....the prices of the lures from china as for the fishing line....its trilene 30 lb test...not much to say about it, its what I always use.
customer_reviews.author: Jefff

customer_reviews.title: Old stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Came with a mound of dust on it. You can tell it’s OLD line. So much memory I didn’t even bother using it after a week.
customer_reviews.author: James h.

customer_reviews.title: Works well for art!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fishing line for a craft project and its been wonderful for it. The line is sheer which is what I needed for the project and it was able to hold my project with no problem. It has a right amount of stretch in it that I don't worry about my project to much. Its also a ton of product for a very affordable cost.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Strong but unusable.
customer_reviews.text: The line is strong. But and its a big big But, This line is just uncastable, has so much of memory that it will keep getting tangled with every other cast. I filled up my reel yesterday, and today after first cast itself, wasted half an hour trying to untangle the mess, before finally giving up and cutting that part of the line.
customer_reviews.author: Rohit Raj

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well. I had to replace my braided line in order to use my own rod and reel on the party boat in Florida we we're going fishing on. Evidently braided line is not allowed.
customer_reviews.author: david harris

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product Working great Easy to install and will recommend to anyone how fishes
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Toler

customer_reviews.title: The only leader line I use.
customer_reviews.text: I use this line to make leaders for catching big catfish. It is so strong and surprisingly easy to work with!
customer_reviews.author: Reid Zuerlein

customer_reviews.title: As my friend and I were fishing and snagging 3 lb bass he was reeling his in fine and my line broke every time lost a ton ...
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it no stars I would. As my friend and I were fishing and snagging 3 lb bass he was reeling his in fine and my line broke every time lost a ton of hooks and bobbers and got really upset that every single one of my fish broke this crappy line
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Brien

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy line
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy line. I use it for things around the house instead of fishing. Used it to hold paper lanterns up all across the yard for a luau party, hold up tall flowers that fall over, etc.
customer_reviews.author: LEELEE

customer_reviews.title: ... on my charter boat and it worked a lot better than the other line I've been using for years
customer_reviews.text: I put this line on one reel and used it all spring and summer on my charter boat and it worked a lot better than the other line I've been using for years. No breakoffs and it caught hundreds of walleyes.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I use it on a 12' surf stick and it's been great. Very little memory and seems stout enough to haul an anchor up.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Sockwell

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It’s not for me i ordered this for a friend but he told me that it was a great product indeed
customer_reviews.author: YnnamofTX

customer_reviews.title: Dependable mono and available in 8 lb test - never seen for Big Game before...
customer_reviews.text: I use Big Game for several applications. It's strong and very reasonable in price. I often experiment with different types (mono, braids, fluoro, etc.) and brands. For mono Big Game has always been a winner. The big win for Big Game here is that Amazon had it 8 lb test! I've never seen it below 10lb at other retailers.
customer_reviews.author: Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good price value.  Over all decent line.
customer_reviews.text: Nice thin line with low memory. I am not sure how old it is. I get easy breaks sometimes when I tie a knot.
customer_reviews.author: John Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great for Photography
customer_reviews.text: Must have product for commercial photographers. This color line is easy to remove in post. Good weight for holding items etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mwags

customer_reviews.title: We use this for heavy duty river fishing
customer_reviews.text: This is some of the toughest mono line i've ever used. Been using Big Game for a lifetime
customer_reviews.author: chessie

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Pulled in 3 20+ pound carp from the river this weekend without breaking a line. Cant beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Mono Line
customer_reviews.text: Great product, have caught up to 45 lbs tuna on this line. Easy to work with, doesn't crimp or lose shape.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Thomason

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I used the product to make necklaces n I like it because it keeps my beads on for my necklaces
customer_reviews.author: MelnLaney

customer_reviews.title: Quality monofilament
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Berkley Trilene for forty five years, and it has always been a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Line looks and feels good. Only getting a 3 because I was not ...
customer_reviews.text: Line looks and feels good. Only getting a 3 because I was not able to use on last fishing trip. Ended up going with a heavier line due to the size of the fish and cover.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: What more can I say? Huge spool of mono for cheap. My uses of 12 lb test mono are simple: - Back fill on my reel before braid - Tying breakaway weight rigs for saltwater: a must if you know you're fishing structure like rocks and expect to snag often! It's always best to just sacrifice one piece than to lose the entire rig.
customer_reviews.author: noc

customer_reviews.title: Spool of line I received was old. The line ...
customer_reviews.text: Spool of line I received was old. The line had taken a set on the spool. Came off spool all curly and curls up if slack in line.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Berkley Trilene Big Game Monofilament Fishing Line (All Colors & Lengths)
product_meta.description:
One of the most popular monofilaments in North America due to its incredible strength, reliability, and value, Berkley Trilene Big Game Fishing Line boasts extreme fighting power for big-game fish, whether saltwater or freshwater. Trilene Big Game's amazing strength gives you confidence and control, while its shock-resistant design allows controlled stretch for awesome fighting power. The line also boasts exceptional abrasion resistance, making it super-tough against rough or sharp objects, as well as outstanding knot strength for durable holding power.
